answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that discuss employee engagement.  
This article describes an Employee Engagement Development Planning program used in Olathe, KS.
http://icma.org/en/Article/10852/Creating_Engagement_and_Results_through_Online_Employee_Development_Planning
This case study from the City of Montgomery, OH details their transition to an HPO Business Model. Part three of this strategy relies on team innovations to help improve the organizational culture of the office.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303024/ICMA_Strategic_Leadership__Governance_Awards
A similar use of team work has been implemented in Independence, MO.
http://icma.org/en/Article/11340/Independence_MO_Develops_IDEA_Academy
The 2011 ICMA Annual Conference hosted a session on best practices of employee engagement. It includes specific programs and their success. You can view the two part PowerPoint presentation below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303347/Employee_Engagement_Part_1
This is a PM article about leadership’s role in fostering employee engagement.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1165/Leadership_and_Employee_Engagement
I hope these are a helpful start to your research!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Anne-Marie Wolff
text: I'm a graduate student in the Learning and Organizational Change program at Northwestern University.  I'm looking for examples of local governments using participative decision-making in teams to foster team member development in support of the organization's succession planning efforts.  Please contact me if you know of any local government doing so.   Thanks in advance!  Anne-Marie
title: Participative Decision Making in Teams
